item.title: Secure Cloud & Infrastructure
item.description: Your infrastructure is the foundation of your compliance posture. We design and build secure CMMC enclaves that isolate CUI from the rest of your network. Using Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform/Ansible), we deploy compliant architectures with proper encryption, access controls, and boundary protection baked in. Experience with AWS GovCloud, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, and hybrid environments ensures your data stays safe and your hosting meets FedRAMP requirements.

item.title: Fractional IT & Compliance
item.description: You don’t need a full-time CIO or CISO to be secure. We provide fractional IT leadership and support tailored to small defense contractors. We handle day-to-day helpdesk needs, server administration, and security updates while maintaining the documentation required for CMMC. Stop worrying about whether your admin is logging the right events or if your backups are encrypted. We handle the technical details so you can focus on fulfilling your contracts.

item.title: CMMC Compliance
item.description: Defense contractors face mandatory CMMC certification. We provide end-to-end support from initial assessment through successful certification. Recent successful Level 1 attestation with IonDesign included scope assessment, gap analysis, POA&M development, and implementation. Experience also includes enterprise-wide NIST 800-171 implementation as ISO/ISSO. Whether Level 1 self-attestation or Level 2 preparation, we guide organizations through compliance requirements efficiently. For a more comprehensive overview, please visit our CMMC Compliance page.

item.title: Automated Compliance
item.description: Manual compliance is expensive and error-prone. We use DevOps principles to automate your security governance. By implementing configuration management and continuous monitoring, we ensure that your systems stay compliant, not just during an audit window. We build pipelines that automatically validate security controls, enforce secure baselines, and generate the evidence you need for your System Security Plan (SSP).
